sen.j: 畠山 高政（はたけやま たかまさ）は、戦国時代 (日本)の紀伊国・河内国の守護大名・戦国大名。
sen.e: Takamasa HATAKEYAMA was a Shugo Daimyo (provincial military governor)/warlord of Kawachi/Kii provinces.
Takamasa HATAKEYAMA was a Shugo Daimyo (provincial military governor) and Sengoku Daimyo (warlord) of Kawachi and Kii provinces during the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: 解釈に問題がありました。
sen.e: Takamasa HATAKEYAMA was a Shugo Daimyo (provincial military governor) and Sengoku Daimyo (warlord) of Kawachi and Kii provinces during the Sengoku Period.

sen.j: 畠山尾州家（畠山政長流）の当主。
sen.e: Masanaga HATAKEYAMA was head of the Hatakeyama Bishu family.
He was head of the Hatakeyama Bishu family (Masanaga HATAKEYAMA's branch).
sen.cmt: 解釈に問題がありました。
sen.e: He was head of the Hatakeyama Bishu family (Masanaga HATAKEYAMA's branch).

sen.j: 大永7年（1527年）、畠山政国の嫡男として生まれる。
sen.e: Takamasa was born in 1527; the eldest legitimate son and heir of Masakuni HATAKEYAMA.
Takamasa was born in 1527; the eldest legitimate son and heir of Masakuni HATAKEYAMA.
Takamasa was born in 1527 as the eldest legitimate son and heir of Masakuni HATAKEYAMA.
sen.cmt: セミコロンを使用する必要はないと思います。

sen.j: 将軍足利義澄（当時は義高）より諱を賜り高政と名乗る。
sen.e: Takamasa was bestowed this posthumous name by Shogun Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA (Yoshitaka at the time).
Takamasa was a name given to him by Shogun Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA (Yoshitaka at the time).
sen.cmt: 解釈に問題がありました。
sen.e: Takamasa was a name given to him by Shogun Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA (Yoshitaka at the time).

sen.j: 紀伊および河内の守護に任命される。
sen.e: Takamasa was appointed as Shugo (military governor) of Kii and Kawachi provinces.
Takamasa was appointed as Shugo (military governor) of Kii and Kawachi provinces.
Takamasa was appointed as Shugo (military governor) of Kii and Kawachi provinces.

sen.j: 天文 (日本)15年（1546年）に三好政長と摂津国の舎利寺の戦いで、父の援助を受けて勝利した。
sen.e: In 1546 Takamasa was victorious against Masanaga MIYOSHI in the Battle of Shari-ji temple (Settsu Province) thanks to reinforcements from his father.

sen.j: しかし天文17年（1548年）、三好長慶の反撃を受けて敗れ、長慶と講和を結ばざるを得なくなった。
sen.e: However, in 1548, Takamasa was defeated in a counter offensive by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and had to conclude a peace arrangement.
However, in 1548, he was defeated in a counter offensive by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and had to conclude a peace arrangement.
sen.cmt: 解釈に問題がありました。
sen.e: However, in 1548, he was defeated in a counter offensive by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and had to conclude a peace arrangement.

sen.j: 天文19年（1550年）に父の死で家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: Takamasa became head of his family following his father's death in 1550.
Takamasa became head of his family following his father's death in 1550.
Takamasa became head of his family following his father's death in 1550.

sen.j: 天文20年（1551年）に河内守護代の遊佐長教が暗殺されると、安見宗房（直政）を守護代とする。
sen.e: Following the assassination of Kawachi Province acting governor Naganori YUSA in 1551, Munefusa YASUMI became acting governor.
Following the assassination of Kawachi Province acting governor Naganori YUSA in 1551, Munefusa YASUMI became acting governor.
Following the assassination of Kawachi Province acting governor Naganori YUSA in 1551, Munefusa YASUMI became acting governor.

sen.j: その後、しばらくは畿内で覇権を掌握した三好長慶に従属したが、天文22年（1553年）から再び対立し、敗れた高政は紀伊国に後退した。
sen.e: Subsequently, for a period of time he was dependent on Masanaga MIYOSHI who held a grasp on the hegemony over the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) however, confrontation again erupted in 1553 and Takamasa having lost, decamped to Kii Province.

Subsequently, for a period of time he was subservient to Nagayoshi MIYOSHI who held a grasp on the hegemony over the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) however, confrontation again erupted in 1553 and Takamasa having lost, decamped to Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 訳された名前が間違っていました。解釈に問題がありましたので、変えました。
sen.e: Subsequently, for a period of time he was subservient to Nagayoshi MIYOSHI who held a grasp on the hegemony over the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) however, confrontation again erupted in 1553 and Takamasa having lost, decamped to Kii Province.

sen.j: その後は河内に戻り六角義賢と手を結んだうえで三好氏と抗争を続けていたが、永禄元年（1558年）11月30日、守護代の安見宗房の離反によって居城の河内高屋城を追放されて堺市に逃れる。
sen.e: There afterwards, he formed an alliance with Yoshikata ROKKAKU (who had returned to Kawachi Province) and continued the strife with the Miyoshi clan however, on Nov 30, 1558 he was banished from the castle of Takaya KAWACHI and escaped to Sakai City following a falling-out with Shugodai (deputy military governor) Munefusa YASUMI.

He returned to Kawachi Province, where he formed an alliance with Yoshikata ROKKAKU and continued his feud with the Miyoshi clan however, on Nov 30, 1558 he was banished from the castle of Takaya KAWACHI and escaped to Sakai City following a falling-out with Shugodai (deputy military governor) Munefusa YASUMI.
sen.cmt: 解釈に問題がありました。
sen.e: He returned to Kawachi Province, where he formed an alliance with Yoshikata ROKKAKU and continued his feud with the Miyoshi clan however, on Nov 30, 1558 he was banished from the castle of Takaya KAWACHI and escaped to Sakai City following a falling-out with Shugodai (deputy military governor) Munefusa YASUMI.

sen.j: そこで、高政は三好長慶と和睦して永禄2年（1559年）8月2日に三好氏の後押しを受けて、安見らを追放して高屋城に復帰した。
sen.e: It was there that Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Takamasa reconciled and on Aug 2, 1559 with the backing of the Miyoshi Clan he evicted Yasumi and returned to Kawachi-jo Castle.
It was there that Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Takamasa reconciled and on Aug 2, 1559 with the backing of the Miyoshi Clan he evicted Yasumi and returned to Kawachi-jo Castle.
It was there that Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Takamasa reconciled and on Aug 2, 1559 with the backing of the Miyoshi Clan he evicted Yasumi and returned to Kawachi-jo Castle.

sen.j: だが永禄3年（1560年）には安見を守護代に戻して長慶と再び対立する。
sen.e: However, in 1560, Yasumi was restored to his position as Shugodai (deputy military governor) and once again antagonized Nagayoshi.
However, in 1560, Takamasa restored Yasumi to the position of Shugodai (deputy military governor) and once again antagonized Nagayoshi.

sen.e: However, in 1560, Takamasa restored Yasumi to the position of Shugodai (deputy military governor) and once again antagonized Nagayoshi.

sen.j: そのため、その年の11月13日に、三好軍が高屋城を占拠して高政・安見らは再び追放された。
sen.e: For that reason, on Nov 13 that year, Miyoshi's army occupied Kawachi-jo Castle whereupon Takamasa and Yasumi were yet again banished.
For that reason, on Nov 13 that year, Miyoshi's army laid siege to and took Kawachi-jo Castle, whereupon Takamasa and Yasumi were both once again banished.
sen.cmt: 解釈に問題がありました。
sen.e: For that reason, on Nov 13 that year, Miyoshi's army laid siege to and took Kawachi-jo Castle, whereupon Takamasa and Yasumi were both once again banished.

sen.j: 永禄4年（1561年）、細川晴元の次男細川晴之・六角義賢とともに京都に進軍し、一時的に三好長慶を京都から追い出すことに成功する。
sen.e: In 1561 Harumoto HOSOKAWA (Harumoto HOSOKAWA`s second son), Yoshikata ROKKAKU advanced together on Kyoto and Nagayoshi MIYOSHI was temporarily successfully expelled from Kyoto.
In 1561 Haruno HOSOKAWA (Harumoto HOSOKAWA`s second son), Yoshikata ROKKAKU advanced together on Kyoto and succeeded in temporarily banishing Nagayoshi MIYOSHI from Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 細川晴之の定訳がわかりませんので”はるの”としました。
sen.e: In 1561 Haruno HOSOKAWA (Harumoto HOSOKAWA`s second son), Yoshikata ROKKAKU advanced together on Kyoto and succeeded in temporarily banishing Nagayoshi MIYOSHI from Kyoto.

sen.j: 永禄5年（1562年）3月5日には久米田の戦いで、長慶の弟である三好義賢を討ち取るという大戦果を収めて、高屋城を奪還する。
sen.e: At the battle of Kumeda on Mar 5, 1562, Nagayoshi`s younger brother Yoshikata MIYOSHI was taken captive (a major military result) and Takaya-jo castle was retaken.
At the battle of Kumeda on Mar 5, 1562, Nagayoshi`s younger brother Yoshikata MIYOSHI was killed (a major military result) and Takaya-jo castle was retaken.
sen.cmt: 解釈に問題がありました。
sen.e: At the battle of Kumeda on Mar 5, 1562, Nagayoshi`s younger brother Yoshikata MIYOSHI was killed (a major military result) and Takaya-jo castle was retaken.

sen.j: しかし、続く5月20日の教興寺の戦いで敗れ、河内における支配権を失い、紀伊に後退した。
sen.e: However, the Battle of Kyoko-ji Temple (which continued to May 20) was lost and any claims to sovereignty in Kawachi were lost and they retreated to Kii Province.
However, they lost their hold on Kawachi and retreated to Kii Province following their loss at the Battle of Kyoko-ji Temple on May 20th.

sen.j: 永禄9年（1566年）5月、長慶没後にその後を継いだ三好義継と和睦し高屋城に戻った。
sen.e: Following Nagayoshi`s death in May 1566, a reconciliation later followed with Yoshitsugu MIYOSHI and he returned to Takaya-jo Castle.
Following Nagayoshi`s death in May 1566, Takamasa reconciled with his heir, Yoshitsugu MIYOSHI and returned to Takaya-jo Castle.

sen.j: 足利義輝が討たれると、義輝の実弟である足利義昭（当時は義秋）を支持し、将軍にするための援助を続けた。
sen.e: With the defeat of Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, he assisted Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA (Yoshiteru`s true younger brother) and continued to support him to become Shogun.

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）には上洛してきた義昭および織田信長に従い、三好氏に奪われていた旧領の一部も安堵され、畠山氏の繁栄を図った。
sen.e: In 1568 returning to the capital, Takamasa secured (by order of either Yoshiaki or ODA Nobunaga the return of his old domain that was seized by the Miyoshi clan and, Takamasa planned for prosperity in the Hatakeyama clan.

In 1568 returning to the capital, Takamasa secured, by order of either Yoshiaki or ODA Nobunaga, the return of his old domain that had been seized by the Miyoshi clan, and worked to bring prosperity to the Hatakeyama clan.

sen.e: In 1568 returning to the capital, Takamasa secured, by order of either Yoshiaki or ODA Nobunaga, the return of his old domain that had been seized by the Miyoshi clan, and worked to bring prosperity to the Hatakeyama clan.

sen.j: しかし主家を傀儡化しようと企んでいた重臣の遊佐信教によって永禄12年（1569年）に河内から追放され、紀伊に移った。
sen.e: However, the main household attempted to pull strings and had the chief retainer Nobuyori YUSA exiled from Kawachi Province to Kii Province.
However, he was exiled from Kawachi in 1569, due to the scheming of Nobuyori YUSA, a chief retainer who plotted to use the family as a puppethead.

sen.j: 天正元年（1573年）に弟の畠山昭高が信教に殺されると挙兵し河内に進攻したが、信教に敗北し紀伊に後退する。
sen.e: In 1573, Takamasa`s younger brother Akitaka HATAKEYAMA was killed by Nobuyori whereupon an army was raised but defeated by Nobuyori and retreated to Kii Province.

In 1573, Takamasa`s younger brother Akitaka HATAKEYAMA was killed by Nobuyori, whereupon Takamasa raised an army and marced on Kawachi Province, but he was defeated and was forced to retreat back to Kii Province.
